name: places/ChIJhUDzgsD3wokRQ2PcndIVB-4
formattedAddress: 256-258 W 125th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 256-258 W 125th St, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text: Walking in you experience a sense of controlled comfortably and above all else attentiveness to your to specific needs. I am thoroughly impressed by how controlled the atmosphere felt when I walked in, because most times I walk into places such as this and it feels chaotic and shows like in everyone's going this way or that way and people are yelling your information for my comfort at times. But not here, I got the sense of respect boundaries and order. You walk in immediately in order to be seen you sign, something new at least for me. Most times, you have to fight to maintain your place in line. For me this is why I like order and control, things run smoother and everyone knows there place.

originalText.text:
So very disappointed in this place. It looks clean and well-kept, but the wait time is absolutely outrageous. All I needed to do is drop off a piece of equipment and I have no idea when I'm going to be brought back. And staff I dealt with at first was very unfriendly.

Three people just left rather than wait longer.

30 minutes later I finally get to step up and  turn in my equipment.

The final representative I dealt with was pleasant.

As an existing Spectrum customer, I had hoped for better.

originalText.text: Knowledgeable and very attentive staff. However if you make an appointment via the app or customer service your visit will be more prompt.

originalText.text: Use to enjoy the customer service here. Sadly management is : unknowledgeable ( " I dont know if you can make phone calls on this expensive new tablet " - manager) likes to argue and escalate situations. Lies about all my words and actions. ( I didn't curse YOU out sir! ) Likes to imply that since he runs this store "I can always find somewhere else to go". I've spent so much money at this Spectrum Store. PLEASE do yourself a favor, stay away from his new bougie workers that care more about their long nails then a woman crying online with her small child. And dont forget he has a henchman that's ready to turn on you like a pancake. I love my Spectrum but I'm now enjoying TMobile. If you have anything to say that's not nice expect him to call police or have you thrown out. Mr. Manager your a joke and I could care less about reading your or any of your companies response to this.

originalText.text: I go all the time here either to pay my bill or if I have a problem with anything they help you right away fast and very nice
